review_title: To KP or not to KP

pros: Good pay and job opportunities after graduation
cons: The culture there is terrible and you'll always be away from home if you sail.

job_title: Sales Consultant in San Jose, CA
cons: Hours are very long and weekends
working a full week wasnt fun

pros: Work hard in the engineering spaces of a variety of vessels throughout the world, learn a great deal and travel. Make good friends with your shipmates and have a generous vacation package.
cons: The work takes you away from your family for extended periods of time, the work environment is often hot and humid and you are likely to get very dirty.

job_title: Sales Consultant in West Burlington, IA
pros: The employees are genuine good people trying to earn a living
cons: Everyday is a different mood with the management staff gets blamed for and management will help if they feel like it that day. If they don't they might not converse with you the whole day or they'll just yell cause they are mad at something else. I would say they bring the negativity from home into the workplace

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Great Neck, NY
pros: Exposure to the professional industry before graduation and a never-ending stream of scenarios conducive to growing a backbone and character.
cons: Justice is all but nonexistent, people who do wrong get promoted and people who get the short end of the stick in a scenario are often further punished for no reason other than being involved.

job_title: Engine Cadet in Kings Point, TN
pros: World travel, high starting salary’s after graduation.
cons: Quality of life on campus is often poor at best.
